content.description:
Squamish is a world-renowned destination for rock climbers, located in the Canadian province of British Columbia. The area is situated between the city of Vancouver and the resort town of Whistler, nestled at the northern end of Howe Sound.

Squamish is known for its granite cliffs, ranging from single pitch to 800 meters high, and its diverse climbing routes that cater to all skill levels, from beginner to pro. The area offers a mix of traditional and sport climbing as well as bouldering, with well-maintained crags that have been developed over the past several decades.

In addition to climbing, Squamish is also a popular destination for hiking, mountain biking, snow and water sports, making it a year-round outdoor playground for enthusiasts of all types.

The town of Squamish, with a population of just over 20,000, has a laid-back and welcoming vibe, and offers a range of amenities for visitors, including restaurants, cafes, and accommodation options. The area is easily accessible by car, located just an hour's drive from Vancouver, and is serviced by a shuttle bus from the city.

Whether you're a seasoned climber looking for a challenge or a beginner looking to try your hand at the sport, Squamish is a must-visit destination that offers a unique blend of natural beauty and outdoor adventure.

Squamish is simply fantastic and features endless, perfect granite climbing that is basically roadside.  If you want to crag, no problem.  If you want to climb a 15 pitch classic, no problem.  Squamish has it all, including lots of rain.  Just hope it doesn't rain (much) during your visit and you'll love the place.
